title: "correct return type" help shouldn't include `'static`

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: A-suggestion-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: suggestions generated by the compiler applied by cargo fix

labels.name: D-invalid-suggestion
labels.description: A structured suggestion resulting in incorrect code

body:
### Code

```Rust
pub fn foo(x: &str) -> _ {
    (x.is_empty(), x.as_bytes())
}
```


### Current output

```Shell
error[E0121]: the placeholder `_` is not allowed within types on item signatures for return types
 --> src/lib.rs:1:24
  |
1 | pub fn foo(x: &str) -> _ {
  |                        ^
  |                        |
  |                        not allowed in type signatures
  |                        help: replace with the correct return type: `(bool, &'static [u8])`

For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0121`.
```


### Desired output

```Shell
error[E0121]: the placeholder `_` is not allowed within types on item signatures for return types
 --> src/lib.rs:1:24
  |
1 | pub fn foo(x: &str) -> _ {
  |                        ^
  |                        |
  |                        not allowed in type signatures
  |                        help: replace with the correct return type: `(bool, &[u8])`

For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0121`.
```


### Rationale and extra context

The `'static` here will cause a borrowcheck error later, because it's coming from the argument.
```
error: lifetime may not live long enough
 --> src/lib.rs:2:5
  |
1 | pub fn foo(x: &str) -> (bool, &'static [u8]) {
  |               - let's call the lifetime of this reference `'1`
2 |     (x.is_empty(), x.as_bytes())
  |     ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ returning this value requires that `'1` must outlive `'static`
```

I hypothesize that it'd be better to not have the `'static` so that it'll work for lifetime elision cases like this than to only work for literals.  (Or maybe it could attempt to be smart and include `'static` if there's no parameter lifetime, but omit it otherwise?)

### Other cases

_No response_

### Anything else?

Playground repro: <https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=nightly&mode=debug&edition=2021&gist=7f65cb9bf760945e44658e468e7d48b0>
